title: 'I neither knew nor seen him', is this correct? - Quora

response.answer_text: No. You do not say “I seen him.” You say “I saw him.” All your original sentence does is make the sentence negative. I does not change the tense. If you reversed the verbs it would be easier to see that it is incorrect: “I neither seen him nor knew him.” The correct verb is “saw,” thus, “I neither knew him nor saw him” is the correct form.

That is not grammatically correct. Here are some better options: I neither knew nor saw him. I neither knew nor have ever met him. I don’t know him and have never met him. The third seems most natural to me. I don’t think that we can accurately say that we have never seen someone, because if we don’t know the person how can we be sure that we didn’t see them in passing?
